summary: I WAS ATTEMPTING A RIGHT HAND TURN AT THE INTERSECTION THROUGH A GREEN LIGHT AND TRAVELING APPROXIMATELY 30 MPH.  I APPLIED MY BRAKES AS I WENT INTO THE TURN AND THE PEDAL REACHED THE FLOOR WITH NO BRAKING RESPONSE.  I THEN PUMPED THE BRAKES TWO MORE TIMES, THE FIRST TIME I FELT MINIMAL RESISTANCE YET THE BRAKE PEDAL WENT TO THE FLOOR WITH AGAIN NO BRAKING RESPONSE, THE SECOND TIME THE BRAKES RESPONDED AND THE CAR WENT INTO A SLIDE TO THE RIGHT TOWARDS ANOTHER CAR.  I TURNED TO THE LEFT AND THE CAR SLID LEFT SPINNING AROUND 180 DEGREES AND THE CAR ENDED UP FACING OPPOSITE IN TRAFFIC WITH THE RIGHT REAR TIRE IMPACTING THE MEDIAN, RESULTING IN A BLOWN  TIRE, CRACKED RIM AND BENT AXLE, LUCKILY NO ONE WAS HURT.  *JB    ***DIMSII IVOQ ENTRY POSTED AFTER 12/12/02 CUT-OVER TO ARTEMIS****725156
